‎10-14-2010 01:34 AM

Hey, it has been forever and a day, I was in the hospital for a VERRRRYY LONG time, but I am currently NOT! Anyway, this is my new account, since some evil little hacker decided to do some wack things to my account. My diabetes is pretty well under control, now if everything else would.......

It is good to come back here, it has been a loooong time (I think since 2008, when I went in the hospital). I have to wear a mask a lot of the time, so I don't go out much, but I am OK.

‎10-14-2010 07:24 AM

WELCOME BACK LAKERBOY!

Yup, we're still here.

Chances are your old account is not really hacked, at least not on these forums. We've been on this new board for almost a year, since Halloween last year. For a lot of us oldtimers, there was an account set up, but with a new password. When we tried to sign in here at first, we had trouble because we didn't know the new password, and the the forum wouldn't let us use our old names, because there was already an account with that name. I bet you have two or more accounts set up now, including one with your real real name.

Anyway...last time I remember hearing from you, you were having trouble with your insurance company because they wanted to dump you and claimed that diabetes was a prexisting condition. I think you were still back east. I don't think we ever heard how that turned out.

This archive is mostly for old posts, things we saved from the old boards, so come on over and visit us on the Adults with Type 2 board and tell us how you are doing. We let people with type 1 visit whenever they want
Report Inappropriate Content

‎10-14-2010 09:07 AM

Hi Lakerboy!

Glad to see you are walking around, even with a mask, and that the Diabetes is not a big issue for you now!

Glad to hear you are out of the hospital--and just as basketball is getting set to start, too.. Were you able to enjoy the Lakers run last spring?

As Molly said your old account may be there somewhere, but int he meantime, you can restore Lakerboy as your screen name with your current sign-in. To do so, click on "MY Stuff" towards the upper left corner, and then on the left side of the page click on Rofile, and where it says screen name, enter Lakerboy, and click on "Only show My Screen Name"

That said you arrive shortly before they change the forums again...

things keep changing but many of us remain the same--we hope you are doing well!

Morris

Diagnosed Type 2, with an A1c of 11.4 in 2003; averaging a 5.0 A1c since then with diet, exercise and Glipizide XL + meds for blood pressure and cholesterol.  A bit dated, but scroll down on this page if you want to know more ...
